result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carnelius C-Angelo Burks

records.addlTxt: Defendant missed court on 10/27/22.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 11/7/22 at 8:30 am, in Branch 29.  Parties notified.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carnelius C-Angelo Burks.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carnelius C-Angelo Burks.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant has a new pending matter. Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference in Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carnelius C-Angelo Burks.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds cause to adjourn the Preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with TAM, her residence, children, workplace, vehicles, etc.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carnelius C-Angelo Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 3.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
